name: Diphtheria and Tetanus Vaccine Adsorbed for Adults and Adolescents®
Diphtheria and Tetanus Vaccine Adsorbed for Adults and Adolescents®

productProfiles.name: EMA-Product Profile: Dengvaxia® (MAH: Sanofi)
productProfiles.composition: Chimeric Yellow Fever Dengue Virus serotypes 1,2,3,4 (live, attenuated); produced in Vero cells, recombinant DNA technology (GMO); storage: 2-8°C; shelf life: 3 years
productProfiles.indication: Dengue prevention against all 4 serotypes in individuals 6-45 years of age with test-confirmed previous dengue infection. To be used based on official recommendations.
productProfiles.dosing: 3 S.C. (e.g. in the deltoid region) doses (0.5 mL each); 6-month intervals.
productProfiles.immunogenicity: Higher antibody responses in adults versus children after 3 doses.
productProfiles.Efficacy(VEy vs virologically confirmed: Pooled VEy vs. symptomatic VCD, children 6-16 years: 62-64% x 25 mo f/u; seropositives: 79.7 – 79.9%VEy-bridging to adults: Immunogenicity after 3 doses is higher in adults than in children, no VEy data.
productProfiles.durationOfProtection: VEy in year 5 and 6: 14% in subjects 6-16 years with previous DV-infection.
productProfiles.coAdministration: Before the use of IgG: 6 wk.- 3 mo. waiting period; TdaP with Dengvaxia first dose: equal responses vs. sequential dosing; only descriptive data with bivalent HPV (similar GMTs co-ad vs sequential) and quadrivalent HPV (ratios in GMT from 0.8 to 1 for co-ad vs sequential) vaccines.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: Headache (51%), pain (49%), malaise (41%), myalgia (41%), asthenia (32%), fever (14%) – independent of serostatus prior to vaccination.
productProfiles.safety: Increased risk of severe Dengue in not-previously DV-infected subjects, mainly 3 years after 1st dose.

productProfiles.name: FDA-Product Profile: Dengvaxia® (MAH: Sanofi)
productProfiles.composition: Chimeric Yellow Fever Dengue Virus serotypes 1,2,3,4 (live, attenuated); produced in Vero cells, recombinant DNA technology (GMO); storage: 2-8°C; shelf life: 3 years
productProfiles.indication: Dengue prevention (against all 4 serotypes) in individuals 6 to 16 years of age with test-confirmed previous dengue infection and living in endemic areas. To be used based on official recommendations.
productProfiles.dosing: 3 S.C. (e.g. in the deltoid region) doses (0.5 mL each); 6-month intervals.
productProfiles.Efficacy(VEy vs virologically confirmed: VEy against VCD (dengue with acute febrile illness (temperature ≥38°C on at least 2 consecutive days) confirmed by dengue RT-PCR (any serotype) and/or dengue non-structural protein 1 (NS1) ELISA Antigen Test) after 3 doses x 12 mo. f/u, 9-16 years: 80.6 % (CI 95% = 50.7, 93.2); 6-14 years: 79.5 % (CI 95% = 44.2, 93.5)
productProfiles.coAdministration: tuberculin PPD testing: before vaccination or at least 1 month following vaccination.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: 9-16 years: headache (40%), injection site pain (32%), malaise (25%), weakness (25%), myalgia (29%); 6-8 years: headache (27%), injection site pain (28%), malaise (19%), weakness (13%), and myalgia (15%).
productProfiles.safety: Increased risk of severe Dengue in not-previously DV-infected subjects.
productProfiles.others: Safety and effectiveness in the geriatric population (65 years of age and older), pregnant women, and breastfeeding have not been established.

productProfiles.name: WHO-Product Profile: Dengvaxia® (MAH: Sanofi)
productProfiles.composition: Chimeric Yellow Fever Dengue Virus serotypes 1,2,3,4 (live, attenuated); produced in Vero cells, recombinant DNA technology (GMO); storage: 2-8°C; shelf life: 3 years
productProfiles.indication: Dengue prevention (against all 4 serotypes) in individuals 6 to 45 years of age with test-confirmed previous dengue infection. To be used based on official recommendations.
productProfiles.dosing: 3 S.C. (e.g. in the deltoid region) doses (0.5 mL each); 6-month intervals.
productProfiles.immunogenicity: Higher antibody responses in adults versus children.
productProfiles.Efficacy(VEy vs virologically confirmed: Pooled VEy vs. symptomatic VCD, children 6-16 years: 62-64% x 25 mo f/u; seropositives: 79.7 – 79.9% VEy-bridging to adults: Immunogenicity after 3 doses is higher in adults than in children, no VEy data.
productProfiles.durationOfProtection: VEy in year 5 and 6: 14% in subjects 6-16 years with previous DV-infection.
productProfiles.coAdministration: Before the use of IgG: 6 wk- 3 mo waiting period; can be co-administer with Tdap and HPV vaccines.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: Very common (1 in 10 people): Headache, myalgia, malaise, myalgia, weakness, fever, erythema.
productProfiles.safety: Increased risk of severe Dengue in not-previously DV-infected subjects, mainly 3 years after 1st dose.
productProfiles.others: Vaccination is not recommended for travelers who have never lived in an endemic area.

productProfiles.name: EMA-Product Profile: Qdenga® (MAH: Takeda)
productProfiles.composition: Dengue Virus serotypes 1,2,3,4 (live, attenuated); produced in Vero cells, recombinant DNA technology (GMO); storage: 2-8°C; shelf life: 18 months
productProfiles.indication: Dengue prevention (against all 4 serotypes) in individuals > 4 years of age. To be used based on official recommendations.
productProfiles.contraindication: Hypersensitivity; acute febrile illness; immunosuppressed individuals*; pregnancy; breastfeeding.
productProfiles.dosing: Two S.C. doses (0.5 mL each) e.g. in the deltoid region; 3-month intervals.
productProfiles.immunogenicity: In the absence of correlates of protection for dengue, the clinical relevance of immunogenicity data remains to be fully understood.
productProfiles.Efficacy(VEy vs virologically confirmed: VEy in preventing VCD fever in children 4-16 years: 80.2% (CI 95% = 73.3, 85.3); VEy in preventing hospitalizations due to VCD fever: 90.4 (CI 95% =  82.6, 94.7.
productProfiles.durationOfProtection: VEy in preventing VCD fever and hospitalizations in children 4-16 years 4.5 years after vaccination: 84.1% (CI 95% = 77.8, 88.6).
productProfiles.coAdministration: Before use of IgG: 6 wk. - 3 mo. waiting period; can be administered with HepA vaccine (adults) or yellow fever vaccine.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: Injection site pain (50%), headache (35%), myalgia (31%), injection site erythema (27%), malaise (24%), weakness (20%) and fever (11%).
productProfiles.safety: Transient vaccine viremia was observed after 1st dose in 49% of study participants never infected and in 16% of study participants who had been previously infected. Vaccine viraemia was rarely detected after the second dose.
productProfiles.others: Safety and efficacy of Qdenga in <4 years not yet established; no data on the use >60 years; limited data in patients with chronic medical conditions; no clinical efficacy study available in subjects >17 years of age, clinical efficacy for >17 years has been inferred from the clinical efficacy in 4-16 years.

productProfiles.name: WHO-Product Profile: Qdenga® (MAH:Takeda)
productProfiles.composition: Dengue Virus serotypes 1,2,3,4 (live, attenuated); produced in Vero cells, recombinant DNA technology (GMO); storage: 2-8°C; shelf life: 18 months
productProfiles.indication: Dengue prevention (against all 4 serotypes) in individuals > 6 years of age. To be used based on official recommendations.
productProfiles.contraindication: Hypersensitivity; acute febrile illness; immunosuppressed individuals*; pregnancy; breastfeeding.
productProfiles.dosing: Two S.C. doses (0.5 mL each) e.g. in the deltoid region; 3-month intervals.
productProfiles.immunogenicity: In the absence of correlates of protection for dengue, the clinical relevance of immunogenicity data remains to be fully understood.
productProfiles.Efficacy(VEy vs virologically confirmed: VEy in preventing VCD fever in children 4-16 years: 80.2% (CI 95% = 73.3, 85.3); VEy in preventing hospitalizations due to VCD fever: 90.4 (CI 95% =  82.6, 94.7)
productProfiles.durationOfProtection: VEy in preventing VCD fever and hospitalizations in children 4-16 years 4.5 years after vaccination: 84.1% (CI 95% = 77.8, 88.6).
productProfiles.coAdministration: Before use of IgG: 6 wk. - 3 mo. waiting period; can be administered with HepA vaccine (adults) or yellow fever vaccine.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: Very common (>10%): injection site pain or redness, headache, muscle pain, generally feeling unwell, weakness, infections of the nose or throat, fever.
productProfiles.safety: Transient vaccine viremia was observed after 1st dose in 49% of study participants never infected and in 16% of study participants who had been previously infected. Vaccine viraemia was rarely detected after the second dose.
productProfiles.others: No data in adults above 60 years of age.

name: Haemophilus influenzae type b Conjugate Vaccine®
Abrysvo®
description: Abrysvo™ is a vaccine developed by Pfizer to prevent lower respiratory tract disease caused by respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) in certain populations.

General Information.Product profiles: Pfizer's Abrysvo is approved for two key populations: pregnant individuals (for protecting infants) and older adults.
General Information.Pipeline products - summary table: Phase 3 studies ongoing, showing strong safety and immunogenicity data.

Company products, pipeline.Pivotal publications / data vaccines: Published Phase 3 trials showing positive safety and efficacy results.
Company products, pipeline.Interviews: Interviews with leading researchers discussing vaccine progress and approvals.
Company products, pipeline.Relevant literature: Scientific articles on RSV vaccines and Abrysvo’s maternal immunization strategy.
Company products, pipeline.Pipeline products - detailed information: Phase 3 trials for additional age groups.

productProfiles.name:
FDA-Product Profile: Abrysvo™ (Pfizer)
Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) vaccine
productProfiles.composition: Abrysvo contains RSVPreF, a protein-based vaccine designed to prevent RSV infections in targeted populations.
productProfiles.indication: Protects infants from birth to 6 months from RSV-related lower respiratory tract disease (LRTD) when administered between 32 to 36 weeks of pregnancy. Prevents LRTD caused by RSV in older adults.
productProfiles.immunogenicity: Demonstrated strong immune response in pregnant women and older adults, with high neutralizing antibody levels against RSV.
productProfiles.efficacyEndpointsPhase3: Reduction in RSV-related lower respiratory tract disease in infants and older adults.
productProfiles.efficacyData: Results show a significant decrease in severe RSV cases.
productProfiles.durationOfProtection: Several months, with research ongoing on long-term immunity.
productProfiles.coAdministration: Tested with flu vaccines; data supports co-administration in older adults.
productProfiles.reactogenicity: Common side effects include pain at the injection site, fatigue, headache, and muscle pain.
productProfiles.safety: Safe for both pregnant individuals and older adults, with no significant adverse events reported.
productProfiles.vaccinationGoal: Prevent severe RSV infections, particularly in vulnerable groups like newborns and the elderly.
productProfiles.others: FDA-approved for older adults and pregnant women. Phase 3 trials underway for expanded age groups.
